importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the latest update on NFL Week 7 results and key events in the 2025 season.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period of Week 7 in the 2025 NFL season, marked by dramatic comebacks, record-breaking performances, and quarterback benchings, highlighting the volatility and unpredictability of the season so far.

keyTakeAways: The NFL season has seen an unprecedented number of lead changes in the final two minutes of regulation, with 26 such changes in the first seven weeks — the most in history over that span.

The Denver Broncos achieved a historic comeback, overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter to defeat the New York Giants 33-32, becoming the first team since 2007 to overcome a 161-0 lead in such circumstances.
Second-year quarterback Bo Nix of the Denver Broncos threw for 174 yards and two touchdowns and rushed for two scores in the fourth quarter, leading to a game-winning field goal as time expired.

Drake Maye of the New England Patriots broke Tom Brady’s franchise record for completion percentage (88.5%) with a 91.3% mark in a 31-13 win over the Tennessee Titans, becoming the first player in Super Bowl era to complete 90% of passes, throw over 200 yards, and rush for over 50 yards in a single game.

Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa was benched in the fourth quarter after throwing three interceptions, including one returned for a touchdown, and was replaced by rookie Quinn Ewers after a 31-6 loss to the Cleveland Browns.

New York Jets quarterback Justin Fields was benched at halftime after a poor first half (6-of-12, 46 yards), and replaced by Tyrod Taylor, who threw two costly interceptions, leading to a 13-6 loss to the Carolina Panthers.
The New England Patriots' performance by Drake Maye is seen as a sign of organizational growth and a potential new franchise cornerstone following Tom Brady’s departure.
The dramatic benchings of Tagovailoa and Fields reflect growing pressure on struggling quarterbacks and a shift in coaching decisions in response to on-field performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season was defined by dramatic comebacks, record-breaking performances, and high-profile quarterback benchings. The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter to beat the New York Giants 33-32, becoming the first team since 2007 to do so after leading by 18 points or more after three quarters. Second-year quarterback Bo Nix delivered a standout performance, throwing for two touchdowns and rushing for two scores, culminating in a game-winning field goal. Meanwhile, Drake Maye of the New England Patriots broke Tom Brady’s franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate in a 31-13 win over the Tennessee Titans, becoming the first player in Super Bowl era history to complete 90% of passes, throw over 200 yards, and rush for over 50 yards in a single game. On the other hand, Tua Tagovailoa of the Miami Dolphins and Justin Fields of the New York Jets were both benched due to poor performances, with Tagovailoa replaced by rookie Quinn Ewers and Fields replaced by Tyrod Taylor. The week highlighted the unpredictability and volatility of the NFL season, with teams rising and falling dramatically in a matter of minutes, showcasing both resilience and fragility in modern football.
title: Historic and dramatic comebacks, second-year QB breaks Tom Brady record and high-profile benchings: NFL Week 7 Sunday review
